page.title: 17RECREATION _ BORTH
page.content: Uppingham School donated about Â£1,000 to be used for the playing fields. The boggy land at Wern Common was drained and named Uppingham Playing Fields. They are owned and run by Borth Town Council. There are many facilities provided _ a playground with a slide and see saw, a sports pavilion, two tennis courts, a crazy golf course, a large football pitch, BMX course and trampolines, and, hopefully, a cricket pitch in 1986. A person is employed to look after the activities during the summer _ collect payments, cut grass and keep the place tidy. There are local football, cricket and badminton teams which compete against neighbouring teams. Borth Golf Club, an 18 hole course, extends from the northern tip of Borth to the Ynyslas sand dunes .
